input_options.title: Input Options
input_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data.

manifest.description: Path to a CSV manifest comprising 4 columns (ID, REP, R1, R2). ID is an arbitrary sample ID, REP describes replicate structure, R1 and R2 columns contain paths to *.fastq.gz files.

annotation.description: Path to genome annotation in GFF format.

library_strandedness.description: Strandedness of the RNAseq library. Options: reverse, forward, none.

output_options.title: Output Options
output_options.description: Define what output the pipeline should save.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

keep_sorted_bam.description: Keep the sorted bam files generated from mapping.

combine_fastqs.description: Combine fastqs at replicate level, based on the replicate structure described in the manifest.

combine_rep.description: Combine fastqs at sample level, based on sample identifiers provided in the manifest.

fastp_args.description: Options and arguments that will be supplied to fastp to modify QC behaviour.

dedup.description: Remove duplicates (hopefully library prep artifacts) from bam file post-mapping.

bowtie2_args.description: Options and arguments that will be supplied to Bowtie2 to modify mapping behaviour.

htseq_args.description: Options and arguments that will be supplied to htseq-count to modify counting behaviour.

samtools_filter_args.description: Arguments supplied to samtools to will be used to filter alignments of interest for counting.
samtools_filter_args.help_text: Acceptable arguments: -f, -F, --rf, -G, -e. See https://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools-view.html for more details. The default will only keep reads that aligned in proper pairs.

annotate_feature_assignment.description: Generate an annotated bam file where each read is assigned to the feature for which is has been counted.

pairwise.description: Generate pairwise sample comparison coverage plots.

coverage_window_size.description: Size of window or step over which to compute cumulative per base coverage (output as a wig file).

coverage_context.description: Size of context around the annotated region (coverage_window_size base pairs either side) in the coverage plot.

resource_request_options.title: Resource Request Options
resource_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries before ingnoring process failure.

retry_strategy.description: Default retry strategy (used in the event that software fails to process data for an unexpected reason)

submit_rate_limit.description: LSF-specific: Change the rate at which the pipeline will submit jobs on the cluster.

queue_size.description: LSF-specific: Maximum number of jobs pipeline will submit jobs on the cluster at any given time.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory in which to save pipeline reporting information.

generic_config_base.description: Inherit configuration from a base URL.

generic_config_version.description: Specify the version to inherit (will be appended to base URL).

generic_config_url.description: Override the above with a generic config URL (or file path).

nf_core_custom_config_version.description: Specify the version of nf-core configs to inherit (will be appended to base URL).

input.description: Ignore: Parameter inherited but not used by this pipeline.
